Belle Boyd House and Museum

Who was Belle Boyd?

Berkeley County Historical Society

Additional history of Berkeley County, written by Don Wood, former president of the historical society.

Newspaper Extracts — Information coming soon

Extracted information from early newspaper articles with a connection to Berkeley County, mostly from the first half of the last

century.

Surnames — Coming Soon

Schools

List of schools in Berkeley County, West Virginia. Wikipedia also has webpages that share more information about the schools, listed by type of school (high, middle, intermediateand elementary/primary).

Miscellaneous West Virginia Links

State of West Virginia The official state page.

West Virginia Tourism Places and things to see and do! Get a free tourism guide.

West Virginia Facts A wealth of info and facts on West Virginia.

Genealogy Links

A subscription or fee may be required for some of these links, but most offer some information for free. Some also offer a "trial period", where you can research free for a certain amount of time before deciding to join the site or purchase the software. Others are completely free. Some links may be for the purchase of software to keep track of your family trees. For now, they are just listed; in the coming weeks I will research each of them to determine the status. Note: these are listed in slphabetical order, not in order of which are free, the best, preferences, etc.

Ancestry

Fee required for complete access, but does offer a free trial and provides some information for free.

Cyndi's List

Online since 1996, Cyndi's List is a one-woman operation and contiues to be free, though donations are accepted, per this page of her website Why Donate.

Family Search

According to their website, the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints provides FamilySearch free of charge to everyone, regardless of tradition, culture, or religious affiliation. FamilySearch resources help millions of people around the world discover their heritage and connect with family members.

My Trees

According to the website, there are three options available, two for free review and one premium subscription. My Trees offers family trees posted by researchers. The site may have formerly been called Kindred Konnections.

Lineages

At first glance, this website appears to be a DNA analysis website, a very expensive process! Will be reviewing it further.

One Great Family

It looks like a paid subscription is required to do more than see how many familly trees for your last name are in the website

USGenWeb —Always free access.

WVGenWeb —Always free access

WorldGenWeb —Always free access
